title: ISic000109. I.Sicily inscription 000109
body:
1[---c]ura vic [---]
2[---]per sing(ulos) mens(es) [---]

1[---.]URAVIC[---]
2[---]PERSINGMENS[---]

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text from Gualtherus;
  • 2: Mommsen: PER 路 SING 路 MENS (but there is no basis for the interpunctuation)

translation

commentary

Mommsen speculated that line 1 might be "cura(vit)", and that the fragment might be part of the same inscription as the two fragments united under CIL 10.7360 = ISic000111 (also lost) (Bivona's suggestion that this is plausible because the graphical representation in Gualtherus is analogous is of little value, since this is a very generic type of representation in Gualtherus' edition).

bibliography

  • Gualtherus 1624 no. 115 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002388
